newsitem.title: TURKEY: Turkish court annuls state property sale law.
newsitem.headline: Turkish court annuls state property sale law.

text.p: Turkey's constitutional court on Thursday annulled a law enabling the government to sell state property, setting back Islamist Prime Minister Necmettin Erbakan's economic plans.
A court official told Reuters the court had taken its decision after 113 deputies from two opposition left-wing parties applied for the law's cancellation.

The law, published in Turkey's official gazette on September 12, was designed to make property sales easier as part of the government's first revenue-raising package after coming to power in late June.
The coalition had aimed to raise 300 trillion Turkish lira from the sell-offs.
